attributes.action: Maintaining the permanent residence path for refugees with residence for 5 years
attributes.additional_details:
Maintaining the course of permanent residence after five years without change or unjustified tightening.
Ensure that assistance to the most vulnerable continues to be provided for appropriate, integration period determined by government agencies to ensure effective and sustainable integration.
We hope that the government will consider these demands, which reflect the spirit of justice and humanity, and maintain the stability of society and the effectiveness of migration and integration policies.
attributes.background: Ensuring permanent residency after five years of continuous legal residence is a fundamental pillar of psychological, social, and economic stability for refugees, enabling them to integrate effectively and contribute to society.

rejection.details:
Keep the 5-Year ILR route for refugees. Do not extend it to 10 or 20 years 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751443
